intro: [WRONG START] Embilia subcoriacea, commonly known as the rough-leafed embelia, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature. Embelia subcoriacea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
